body: $PQEFF my opinion of what will/has happened. The COO accepted the TO and will receive $0.59 per share in exchange once the deal goes through. However
created_at: the share price will likely sky rocket past $0.59 to $1+ before returning to settle around the offer price. The catalyst for that movement will be in the PRs in the next few weeks to come. Some uncertainty will exist in the PR that the market will imply as bullish
column3: uncertainty if the Viston price is enough or potentially an agreement has been reached after Viston agreed to increase their price or another offer from separate company is announced. The bidding war that has been hypothesized would at that point officially commence. This will be sold prior to February

body: $PQEFF Here is my opinion:It‚Äôs always darkest before the dawn. Try to ignore the noise and negativity until mid January. If someone was trying to bring the price down and create fear and panic selling they are succeeding right now
created_at: we know the Haywood report is coming and we know that the board recommendation is coming after that (which may be the board saying to accept the offer). Tendering now does not help anything but if you feel you want to tender then by all means go ahead but it will not prevent Viston from pulling the offer if that is what they want to do
column3: they could have 90% of shares tendered in January and still pull the offer
column4: people are grasping at ways to gain control of a situation that is beyond our control and if tendering prevents you from selling your shares at under 20 cents then tendering is way better than not tendering in my opinion
column5: but if you can wait it out until after the Haywood report at least you will have more information to make your decision.
